title: Chloe Kelly has the  fire  to inspire Arsenal , says head coach Renee Slegers
body_text:
Chloe Kelly has the â€˜fireâ€™ to inspire Arsenal, says head coach Renee Slegers
Arsenal head coach Renee Slegers expects Chloe Kellyâ€™s inner â€œfireâ€ to be directed at helping her team-mates get their Womenâ€™s Super League campaign back on track rather than proving a point against her former club Manchester City.
England forward Kelly returned to the Gunners on loan last January, which became a permanent move in the summer after her contract with City expired.
As speculation continued over her future during the winter transfer window, Kelly had posted on Instagram that she wanted â€œto be happy againâ€ and did not see herself at City beyond the end of the campaign.
Made for the big moments âœ¨ pic.twitter.com/8qRxMYJb1C
â€” Lionesses (@Lionesses) July 27, 2025
Kelly has since gone on to help the Gunners lift the 2025 Champions League as well as play a key role in Englandâ€™s European Championship success â€“ scoring the winning kick in the penalty shoot-out victory over Spain as the Lionesses retained their trophy.
Slegers is confident Kelly will not let the occasion get the better of her this weekend when the Gunners face City at the Joie Stadium looking to respond after conceding a stoppage-time goal to draw 1-1 with Aston Villa.
â€œI think Chloe has gone through a lot of things in her football career. She is now representing us and we are very proud of that,â€ Slegers said at a press conference.
â€œI think she will find the right levels. I think that is special with Chloe, that she has fire inside her.
â€œWhen she uses it in the right way, which she has been doing, it creates so much for herself and for the team. That will be no different for her tomorrow.â€
Manchester City sit third heading into the next round of WSL fixtures, with their only defeat coming against champions Chelsea on the opening weekend.
City head coach Andree Jeglertz has warned his side they must not just focus on getting results against the WSLâ€™s bigger teams.
How the #BarclaysWSL table stands after Gameweek 4ğŸ“Š pic.twitter.com/kRiDFueUxD
â€” Barclays Women's Super League (@BarclaysWSL) September 28, 2025
â€œMost likely it will be four teams battling (at the top) â€“ but it is not also about these games but what we are doing in all the others that will make us in the top three,â€ said Jeglertz, who confirmed Brazil forward Kerolin is set to miss â€œa number of weeksâ€ due to an unspecified â€˜lower bodyâ€™ injury.
Iman Beney was unavailable last weekend but has returned to training and will be in contention to face the Gunners.
Elsewhere on Sunday, Liverpool go in search of a first league win when they head to London City Lionesses.
West Ham â€“ who are also pointless â€“ will be looking for a response following last weekendâ€™s 4-0 defeat by Chelsea when they entertain Aston Villa, Tottenham host Brighton and Leicester take on Everton.
